intro: Coccoloba rubra, commonly known as the red mangrove, is a flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive red, waxy leaves that are often used in traditional medicine. The plant is native to the coastal regions of the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It thrives in saline environments and is commonly found in mangrove forests. Its small, greenish-white flowers are followed by red, fleshy berries that are an important food source for various bird species.
